--- title: "Causality" author: "Sriramkumar Sarida" --- # Famous example: Nicolas Cage films and number of poeple drowned by falling into a pool I came across this devious example of the number of people drowned by falling into a pool correlated with films Nicolas Cage appeared in during the same time period. I would like to recreate this example: https://www.datasciencecentral.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/10/2808309983.png ::: {.cell hash='04_causality_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_456c847f5b4bbec06653a50e05f3296b'} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(99) # for reproducibility years <- 2000:2009 cage_films <- cumsum(sample(1:5, 10, replace = TRUE)) drownings <- cumsum(sample(1:5, 10, replace = TRUE)) + rnorm(10, mean = 0, sd = 0.15) data <- data.frame(Year = years, Cage_Films = cage_films, Drownings = drownings) ``` ::: ::: {.cell hash='04_causality_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_00c95edbb9ccee78f6b7d40f5ca264b8'} ```{.r .cell-code} data ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ::: ::: {.cell hash='04_causality_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_8a61e47758c83794b5ceaa437ac4290a'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggplot2) # Line plot showing trends over time ggplot(data, aes(x = Year)) + geom_line(aes(y = Cage_Films, colour = "Nicolas Cage Films")) + geom_line(aes(y = Drownings, colour = "Drownings by falling into the pool")) + labs(title = "Spurious Correlation between Nicolas Cage Films and Drownings", y = "Count", colour = "Legend") + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_causality_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Scatter plot showing the correlation ggplot(data, aes(x = Cage_Films, y = Drownings)) + geom_point() + labs(title = "Scatter Plot of Nicolas Cage Films vs Drownings", x = "Nicolas Cage Films", y = "Drownings by falling into the pool") + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](04_causality_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-2.png){width=672} ::: :::
